sentence.Network_en: Researchers observed one bird impale a rodent on a cactus.
sentence.Network_cn: 研究人员观察到一只鸟把一只啮齿动物钉在一棵仙人掌上。

sentence.Network_en: The road winds for miles through parched earth, scrub and cactus.
sentence.Network_cn: 公路蜿蜒数英里，穿过炙烤的大地、灌木丛和仙人掌。

sentence.Network_en: It was the first year that the cactus had produced flowers.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是这棵仙人掌第一年开花.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'cardoon'): from Latin, from Greek kaktos 'cardoon'

entry.def: A cactus is a thick fleshy plant that grows in many hot, dry parts of the world. Cacti have no leaves and many of them are covered in prickles.

means.word_mean: 1. any spiny succulent plant of the family Cactaceae native chiefly to arid regions of the New World
